PDC120.name: Introductory Digital Graphic Communications (Interim Change)
PDC120.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC120.description: Basic and fundamental communications to present digital renderings in various forms using digital software.

PDC403.name: Introduction to Domicology: Sustainable Built Environment
PDC403.description: The lifecycle of structures. Causes and impacts of structural abandonment, and sustainable tools, policies, and practices to address it
PDC403.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
PDC403.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

PDC420.name: Advanced Digital Graphic Communications
PDC420.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC420.description: Advanced skills for digital graphic communications. Digital rendering using advanced graphic software programs.
PDC420.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

PDC460.name: Green Roofs and Walls
PDC460.description: Green roof and wall design and installation practices including plant species and substrates. Environmental impact, ecosystem services, integration with other environmental practices. Influence of economics, public policy, and industry organizations on the implementation of green roofs on a wide scale. Multidisciplinary nature of planning and implementation of successful green roof and wall projects.
PDC460.prerequisite: HRT 203 or FW 101 or GEO 206 or PDC 120 or EGR 100
PDC460.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

PDC491.name: Special Topics in Planning, Design and Construction
PDC491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC491.description: Selected topics that integrate content across construction management, interior design, landscape architecture and urban and regional planning.

PDC493.name: Internship in Planning, Design and Construction
PDC493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC493.description: Supervised professional experience in agencies or businesses related to the student's major field of study.
PDC493.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the School of Planning, Design and Construction. Approval of school; application required.

PDC803.name: Advanced Domicology: Sustainable Built Environment (Interim New)
PDC803.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC803.description: Advanced study of the lifecycle of structures. Causes and impacts of structural abandonment, and sustainable tools, policies, and practices to address it. Faculty-guided/student-led research and outreach on a selected Domicology topic.
PDC803.restrictions: Open to graduate students or lifelong graduate students.

PDC853.name: Real Estate Finance and Commercial Development (Interim New)
PDC853.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC853.description: Essential real estate finance concepts, tools and performance metrics to build complete project pro formas. Commercial, mixed-use development team projects.
PDC853.restrictions: Open to graduate students or lifelong graduate students.

PDC858.name: Land Use Planning & Housing (Interim New)
PDC858.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC858.description: Relationship between housing, society, and the economy. Land use planning tools and process. Impact of land use planning on housing development. Housing design, development process, and performance metrics.
PDC858.restrictions: Open to graduate students or lifelong graduate students.

PDC859.name: Construction Management and Real Estate Case Studies (Interim New)
PDC859.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC859.description: Construction management concepts and practices related to real estate development projects, followed by a series of real estate development case studies covering multiple types of projects.
PDC859.restrictions: Open to graduate students or lifelong graduate students.

PDC878.name: Redevelopment and the Climate Resilient City (Interim New)
PDC878.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC878.description: Connection between federal, state and local policies in the practice of urban resilient redevelopment. Best practice techniques for land redevelopment and climate change adaptation for planning, design and construction professionals.
PDC878.restrictions: Open to graduate students or lifelong graduate students.

PDC901.name: Integrated Approach to Sustainable Planning, Design and Construction
PDC901.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PDC901.description: Integrated approach to planning, design, and construction for development of sustainable built environment.
PDC901.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Planning, Design and Construction.

PDC990.name: Special Problems in Planning, Design, and Construction
PDC990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDC990.description: Individual study in construction management and related Built Environment areas.
PDC990.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the School of Planning, Design, and Construction. Approval of department.

PDC992.name: Advanced Research Methods in Planning, Design and Construction
PDC992.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PDC992.description: Current areas and topics of research in planning, design, and construction. Analysis of existing research, and development of preliminary proposal.

PDC999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
PDC999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of even years
PDC999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the School of Planning, Design and Construction.
